summary: This bill, the Protecting Horses from Soring Act of 2025, aims to amend the Horse Protection Act to provide increased protection for horses participating in shows and auctions. Key provisions include defining "objective inspection" using science-based protocols, establishing a Horse Industry Organization (HIO) to oversee inspections and licensing, and mandating disqualification of sore horses. It also lays out the HIO's structure, responsibilities, and licensing requirements, along with a timeframe for the Secretary of Agriculture to issue necessary regulations.
